publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1901 Brian Adam: Proposed National Front March in Aberdeen—That the Parliament congratulates Aberdeen City councillors on their brave decision to ban a proposed march by the National Front and calls on the Scottish Executive to bring forward legislation to ensure that local councillors representing local opinion can make decisions on proposed future marches without fear of oppressive punishment. Supported by: Bill Butler*
S2M-1901 Proposed National Front March in Aberdeen (lodged on 27 October 2004) Scott Barrie*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-1901 Brian Adam: Proposed National Front March in Aberdeen—That the Parliament congratulates Aberdeen City councillors on their brave decision to ban a proposed march by the National Front and calls on the Scottish Executive to bring forward legislation to ensure that local councillors representing local opinion can make decisions on proposed future marches without fear of oppressive punishment. Supported by: Bill Butler, Scott Barrie, Michael Matheson, Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie

S2M-1901 Proposed National Front March in Aberdeen (lodged on 27 October 2004) Elaine Smith*, Tricia Marwick*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Richard Lochhead*, Helen Eadie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Rob Gibson*, Dr Jean Turner*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Robin Harper*
S2M-1901 Proposed National Front March in Aberdeen (lodged on 27 October 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-1901 Proposed National Front March in Aberdeen (lodged on 27 October 2004) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-1901 Proposed National Front March in Aberdeen (lodged on 27 October 2004) Christine May*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-1901 Proposed National Front March in Aberdeen (lodged on 27 October 2004) Linda Fabiani*
